TextSection.Contents: Hemicrania continua is a rare indomethacin-responsive trigeminal autonomic cephalgia characterized by a typically side-locked continuous unilateral headache of moderate intensity with recurrent episodes of exacerbations of severe intensity lasting for more than 3 months in the absence of structural brain or vascular lesions. Ipsilateral cranial autonomic symptoms (lacrimation conjunctival injection nasal congestion or rhinorrhea ptosis/miosis) restlessness and/or migrainous features are observed during the exacerbations.
